title: BBC Local Live: Updates for Norfolk on Tuesday, 8 December 2015 - BBC News
summary: teachers ' union nasuwt raises concerns after the governors of old buckenham primary school were replaced by an interim executive board .
south norfolk village of gissing gets £ 700,000 lottery grant for new village hall .
norwich city will have a new chairman `` within weeks '' after alan bowkett stepped down yesterday , the club says .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: our live coverage through the day
text: that 's the day 's news , sport , travel and weather from the norfolk live team .
we 'll be back tomorrow at 08:00 .
if you 've got a story , photograph or video that you 'd like to share with us , you can get in touch on email , facebook or twitter .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: norwich united are ready to step up
text: the thurlow nunn league has told bbc radio norfolk that norwich united have applied for promotion to the ryman north division for the 2016/17 season .
the planters are the thurlow nunn premier champions and are currently 10 points clear at the top of the league .
four other teams have also applied to step up - stanway rovers , mildenhall town , godmanchester rovers and ipswich wanderers .
author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: coastal village benefits from lottery funding
text: earlier today we told you about the charity that has received nearly £ 750,000 of lottery funding for a new village hall for gissing in south norfolk .
another village to benefit from lottery funding is trimingham (
the north norfolk village has been given a grant of more than £ 28,000 to develop plans for a new village hall - but they also have an option to bid for further funding .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: weather : mainly dry with isolated showers
text: tonight will be mainly dry with clear spells , and a few isolated showers .
feeling cooler , with temperatures falling to 3c ( 37f ) .
tomorrow will be a fine , dry day with plenty of sunshine .
temperatures rising to 10c ( 50f ) .
weather has the latest where you live .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: preliminary work begins on new dual carriageway
text: twelve years after it was first proposed , preliminary work on the new norwich northern distributor road got under way today .
once completed , the 12.4 mile ( 20km ) dual carriageway will run from the a47 in the east to the a1067 in the west - taking thousands of vehicles a day out of the city centre .
construction of the new £ 180m road will begin in march , and is expected to take less than two years to complete .
author: Dawn Gerber

documents.title: headlines : preliminary work begins on northern distributor road lorry carrying 600 turkeys overturns
text: the stories making the news in norfolk this evening :
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: man dies after lorry crashes into tree
text: a man has died after a lorry hit a tree on the a1065 in mundford this morning .
emergency services were called to the scene near the grimes graves turning shortly after 08:40 .
the man , in his 60s , was pronounced dead at the scene .
the road remains closed in both directions .
author: BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: firm 's festive gift of a home for a veteran
text: the front page of today 's lynn news :
author: Lynn News

documents.title: norfolk senior cup last 16 tonight
text: four teams will attempt to get through to the quarter finals of the norfolk senior cup this evening .
at trafford park , holders wroxham will host great yarmouth town .
the tie has already been postponed three times in recent weeks due to a waterlogged pitch .
elsewhere , at emerald park gorleston town play fakenham town .
author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: watch : lorry carrying turkeys overturns
text: a lorry driver was taken to hospital with minor injuries after his vehicle overturned with its load of 600 bernard matthews turkeys inside on the norwich outer ring road earlier today .
the rspca and a welfare officer from bernard matthews were also called to the scene near the notcutts garden centre to monitor the welfare of the birds .
scott norman from the norfolk fire service explains what happened :
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: norwich city youngster wins award
text: norwich city winger jacob murphy has been named as the professional footballers ' association league one player of the month .
murphy is currently on loan at coventry city until the end of the season .
the 20 year old scored six goals in six games last month including a 10 minute hat-trick against gillingham at the ricoh arena .
author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: just the tonic for norwich
text: the first gin distillery for 150 years has opened in norwich , proving just the tonic for customers at the ten bells pub in st benedicts street .
customers can sit and watch the whole process and then share a glass with friends .
head distiller peter smith explains the process
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: canaries handed plum home draw
text: the back page of today 's norwich evening news :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: volunteer drivers need for car scheme
text: a community car scheme which serves 15 parishes in the west of norfolk is looking for more volunteer drivers to help meet demand for its services .

the great massingham area community car scheme provides a lifeline to residents who do n't have access to transport , taking them to appointments and social events and allowing them to remain independent .
demand for the service grew by 10 % last year , and a further 5 % this year .
it 's currently eight drivers short .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: sky blue thinking - it 's a cup cracker
text: the back page of today 's eastern daily press :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: adele is bravest of the brave
text: the front page of today'seastern daily press :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: trekking for wounded veterans
text: a soldier from brundall is walking home to norfolk from his regimental barracks in wiltshire .
staff sergeant zak thorpe is trrekking for the walking with the wounded 's annual christmas campaign , raising funds for wounded veterans who do n't have a home to walk to .
every man on this team is able-bodied we 've been on several operational tours and come home pretty much unscathed but we 've known people who 've not had that luck . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: canary supporters ' coach attacked
text: a norwich city supporters ' coach has been damaged after a stone was thrown at one of its windows in watford .
a group of people approached the vehicle when it was sitting in traffic on hempstead road on 5 november , after norwich had lost 2-0 to watford .
pc james stopford , of hertfordshire police , is appealing for anyone who saw the incident to contact the force .

documents.title: norwich city fans applaud bowkett legacy
text: the norwich city supporters group canaries trust has praised the work done by outgoing chairman alan bowkett who stepped down yesterday .
bowkett is widely praised for helping to keep the club out of administration following their relegation to league one in 2009 .
canaries trust spokesman robin sainty told bbc radio norfolk : `` i do n't think you could overstate the importance of alan bowkett to norwich city 's recent history and indeed its existence . ''
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: south west norfolk mp defends government flood defence spending
text: the south west norfolk mp and energy secretary , liz truss , has defended the amount the government is spending on flood defences , saying there 's only so much they can do .
ms truss said the defences in carlisle had protected it against three previous storms , but this time the defences were `` overtopped '' , with the scale of flooding `` extraordinary '' .
the government is spending £ 2.3bn over six years on flood defences , protecting 300,000 homes .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: official complaint into murder investigation
text: the brother of a man murdered in great yarmouth 31 years ago is to hand in an official complaint about the original police investigation on the anniversary of the death .
peter miller , 24 , was stabbed to death on 9 december 1984.. no-one has ever been charged with his murder .
in april 2013 , bbc look east reporter kim riley returned to the scene of the crime..
he spoke to mr miller 's brother tony , who said he needed answers from the police about his brother 's death .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: lorry with turkeys inside overturns near norwich
text: a lorry carrying turkeys has overturned at a major road junction in norwich .
it happened at the roundabout on newmarket road , near the notcutts garden centre .
traffic is currently blocked travelling northbound into the city and you ca n't turn left onto the ring road .
radio norfolk 's bob carter described traffic as `` very , very snarled up '' .
with motorists facing ' '' huge delays '' .
author: Paul Moseley
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: lunchtime headlines : norfolk hospitals on black alert turkey lorry overturns
text: the stories making the news this lunchtime :
author: BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: joint statement issued on hospitals on black alert
text: a joint statement has been issued on behalf of the james paget hospital in gorleston , the queen elizabeth hospital in king 's lynn and the norfolk and norwich hospital , confirming a high level of demand .
the hospitals say they are working with the east of ambulance service and clinical commissioning groups to keep patients safe .
author: BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: breakingnorfolk 's hospitals on black alert today
text: all of norfolk 's hospitals are on black alert today following a `` high level of demand '' for services .
more to follow .

documents.title: feathers flying on norwich ring road
text: we 're hearing reports a lorry carrying turkeys has overturned on the norwich outer ring road , near to the notcutts roundabout .
we 'll bring you more details as we get them .
author: BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: proposals put forward for historic hotel
text: plans to do up one of the best known hotels in king 's lynn have been submitted to the borough council .
the owners of the duke 's head say new lights on the front of the building would help show off its contours better , but do n't plan to change the building 's blue paintwork .
famous figures to have stayed at the historic building in the heart of the old town include sir robert walpole and princess victoria before she became queen .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: rogue wristbands sellers exposed
text: the front page of today 's norwich evening news :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: planning permission granted for new homes in west norfolk
text: king 's lynn borough council has reassured people living in the marsh lane area that flood defence and drainage will be improved .
the reassurance came as councillors agreed to the first phase of a controversial development , which will see 130 houses built on low-lying land .
councillor alistair beales says there 'll be a big investment in drainage , including a new pumping station .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: running club stalwarts nominated for sports award
text: every year , the bbc recognises unsung heroes , those who inspire people to get involved in sport within the community .
clive and ann baker , from norfolk , are nominees from the eastern region .
without their help , the junior section of the dereham runners ' club would have closed years ago - now , the juniors compete at club , county and national levels .
author: Tom Williams
BBC Look East sport

documents.title: speedway stars explain thursday move
text: king 's lynn stars manager rob lyon has been telling bbc radio norfolk why the club is switching its home race nights to thursday from next year .
the stars have traditionally raced at home on wednesday evenings during the speedway season but will change from the start of the 2016 campaign .
lyon said : `` it 's not just about rider availability , it 's about the future of the elite league .
it 's something we 've been thinking about for quite a while . ''
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: grant of more than £ 700,000 for small village
text: a small village in south norfolk is getting a big lottery grant , of nearly three quarters of a million pounds .
more than £ 710,000 has been given to the community of gissing for a new village hall , which was inherited by village charity the heart of gissing 15 years ago .
it will create a community hub to help bring projects and activities for the village and eight surrounding rural parishes .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: travel : a1065 closed in both directions
text: thea1065 is closedin both directions in mundford , following a serious accident earlier this morning .
emergency services are on the scene , including the air ambulance .
local diversions are in place .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: travel : accident on the a47 westbound
text: emergency services are at the scene of an accident on the a47 westbound between the a140 and a11 .

documents.title: union concerned school could become academy
text: a union has raised concerns that the removal of the governors from old buckenham community primary school could be the first step towards turning it into an academy .
russell hammond , of the nasuwt , believes `` norfolk is actively encouraging a number of schools to become academies '' .

norfolk county council says it removed the governors because it did n't think they could help turn the school round quickly enough - it was rated `` inadequate '' by ofsted inspectors earlier this year .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: canaries promise 'fresh ideas ' from new chairman
text: norwich city football club will have a new chairman `` within a few weeks '' according to a statement from the club .
alan bowkett stepped down yesterday after more than six years in the carrow road boardroom .
the club is promising to find `` additional expertise and fresh ideas about growing the business '' but points out the ownership of the club is unaffected by the changes .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: weather : scattered showers
text: breezy today with rain followed by scattered showers .
feeling colder than of late , with a maximum temperature of 12c ( 54f ) .
a clear dry night , with ground frost in places and lows of 4c ( 39f ) .
weather has further information for your part of the county .
author: Sara Thornton
BBC Weather

documents.title: headlines : union 's concerns over removal of school 's governors lottery grant for south norfolk village

author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: travel : a149 closed at kelling
text: the a149 in kelling is closed , with delays in both directions , because of an earlier accident and fallen power cables .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: welcome to norfolk live
text: hello and welcome to tuesday 's norfolk live page .
we 'll bring you the news , sport , travel and weather updates throughout the day until 18:00 .
if there 's anything you 'd like to share with us , you can send us a tweet or email , or get get in touch on facebook .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live
